The Board of Education of North Merrick Public Schools will hold the Budget Hearing and Special Meeting on June 2, 2020. As authorized by Executive Order No. 202.1, signed by Governor Andrew Cuomo, the meeting will be held remotely by videoconference and the public will not be permitted to attend the meeting in-person.

The meeting will be called to order at 5:00 PM. At that time, it is anticipated that the Board will immediately act upon a motion to convene into Executive Session to obtain legal advice from counsel (the executive session is closed to the public). The Board of Education will reconvene into public session at 6:00 PM to begin the Budget Hearing, followed by a Special Meeting.

The public will be able to view the meeting live via YouTube. The link will be available on the district website one hour prior to meeting.

This video-conferenced meeting will be posted on the district website the next day, to the best of our ability, and transcribed within a reasonable time thereafter.

The North Merrick School District is soliciting applications for the vacancy on the Board of Education, created by the resignation of Trustee John Pinto. This position will run through May 21, 2019.

Interested parties should submit a letter of intent - limited to one page - which includes a short bio, record of community involvement, and the attributes that would make them an ideal candidate for the North Merrick Board of Education. To qualify, candidates must be18 years old and a resident of the North Merrick School District for one year.

Please send letters of intent to the attention of Mrs. Joanne Long, District Clerk, via email by the close of business on Friday, September 7, 2018, at NMBOE@nmerrick.org. Thank you.
